bibl.title: Letter from Mabel H. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, October 30, 1915

div1.p: Mabel Lazear writes that the National Cyclopedia of American Biography plans a biography on Jesse Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from Mabel H. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, October 30, 1915
div1.opener:
no date
Probably about Oct 30, 1915
Dear Ganny-
div1.p:
To-day
I received a notice
from The National
Cyclopedia of Ameri-
can Biography say-
ing that they are to
publish a biography
of Jesse. I have
a long printed form
to make out - some
of the questions I
sent to Uncle Thomas
such as Name the earliest
paternal American
ancestor.- etc. etc.
Please send me the
birth & death of Jesse's
father - and your
fathers name-

I am working on
the questions now but
thought I would stop
to have a little chat
with you- It seems
some time since I
had a letter from
you- Peggy I think
answered your last
letter to them-
They are both very
busy with their
lessons-

I wonder if Aunt Kate
and Francis are
back?- I do hope
that you are feeling
better- My last
letter was so long
that if I do not
hear soon I will
think that you were
“done up” by it-
I am sending you
a book that I hope
may prove interesting
- 5 -
the Derueaus gave
it to me.

We have been 500
miles in the Ford.
It seems too good to
be true that we
have some means
of getting over the
country without
using our feet
and when we have
errands it is sur-
prising how much
- 6 -
we can accomplish
Mother enjoys it
so much-
She said she had
never had any
thing she had got-
ten so much pleas-
ure from-

We had a letter
from Jane to-day
saying that she
may come to California
about the 4 of Nov.
Saturday- Your good
letter has just came
also a telegram from
Jane she arrives to-
night in San Francisco.
Of course Mother is much
excited we do not
know when she is coming
here. My love to
Aunt Kate & Francis - and
much love to Ganny
